etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘image, likeness’): from Old French representation or Latin repraesentatio(n-), from repraesentare ‘bring before, exhibit’ (see represent)

definitions: the action of speaking or acting on behalf of someone or the state of being so represented

examples.text: asylum-seekers should be guaranteed good legal advice and representation

shortDefinitions: action of speaking or acting on behalf of someone or state of being so represented

definitions: the description or portrayal of someone or something in a particular way or as being of a certain nature

examples.text: the representation of women in newspapers

shortDefinitions: description or portrayal of person or thing in particular way

definitions: the depiction of someone or something in a picture or other work of art

examples.text: Picasso is striving for some absolute representation of reality

shortDefinitions: depiction of person or thing in work of art

definitions: a thing, especially a picture or model, that depicts a likeness or reproduction of someone or something

examples.text: a striking representation of a vase of flowers

shortDefinitions: picture, model, or other depiction of person or thing

definitions: (in some theories of perception) a mental state or concept regarded as corresponding to a thing perceived.
shortDefinitions: (in some theories of perception) mental state or concept regarded as corresponding to thing perceived

definitions: formal statements made to a higher authority, especially so as to communicate an opinion or register a protest

examples.text: certain church groups are making strong representations to our government
any buyer was relying on a representation that the tapes were genuine
